result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:26 PM (64-06) Defendant Shawn M Wismer in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Shawn M Wismer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Defense is in receipt of the Information, requesting Arraignment date.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn M Wismer in court. Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.

Defendant Shawn Michael Wismer in court.  Attorney Keith Venema for Caleb Tomaszewski in court for Shawn Michael Wismer. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint o be filed within a couple days; will be felony file. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Shawn M Wismer in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane for defendant. Defendant's mother is present in court and can post. Defendant given attorney options form and referred to SPD. Minutes filed.
